comments.text: This is fantastic! Question.. If I have a channel where I have regular content (ie my own videos) do you recommend I just plot podcast episodes into my regular channel? I have no interest in a standard along podcast but I want to have guests on for discussions.
comments.author: @CoreConceptsWellnessVancouver

comments.text: Super helpful as always! I’m starting a video podcast called “Brides and Zooms”
comments.author: @DavidRothsteinMusic

comments.text: Hi, great video. How about lives. Can you do live streams within the YouTube podcast functionality? Or would you have to add those after? (And delete them from your lives??)
comments.author: @sherylmiller

comments.text: I thinking about starting a podcast cast called Belly Rubs and Biscuits where a dog is the host. He speaks on behaviours dog owners struggle with. What do you think is this a good idea ?
comments.author: @lornathegoodcalmdogcoach

comments.text: One thing I will disagree with, at least at the start of videoing, is to edit your own videos. When you watch things back you get the audience experience, see what works and what doesn’t, so the next time you improve your delivery. Maybe after you’re comfortable with the camera it would be practical to have someone else edit it
comments.author: @WillN00
